mdRecord.dcterms:title: Glass bottle with stopper
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Radium Therapy Co. [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Glass bottle with label reading "Acid Tannic" containing brown residue inside bottle. Embossed on side: "Radiorem" and bottom: "Radium Therapy Co. New York." Bottle owned by August C. Camoriani (1906-1973), a pharmacist who was born and died in San Francisco. He was the owner of Rossi Drug Co. San Francisco, CA and "Mayor of North Beach" the "Little Italy" neighborhood. He served the Italian immigrant community of San Francisco for more than 40 years.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by the Estate of Eric Blum; conveyer: Harriet Nash [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Bottles
